amendment.description: Amendment expresses the sense of the House that institutions of higher education should not take actions which prevent students from expressing freedom of speech or association.
amendment.purpose: An amendment, printed as amendment No. 64 in the Congressional Record to express the sense of the House that institutions of higher education should not take actions which prevent students from expressing freedom of speech or association. The amendment does not prevent institutions from imposing sanctions on students who willfully participate in a disruption of a lecture, speech, or presentation.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Livingston amendment (A035) Agreed to by voice vote.
